basics.name: Richard Hendricks
basics.label: Founder & Software Engineer
basics.summary: Software engineer with a passion for distributed systems, lossless compression, and ethical data handling. Former Hooli engineer turned founder of Pied Piper, where I led the development of a revolutionary decentralized internet platform. Enjoys working on elegant backend systems and solving complex information theory problems.

work.summary: Built a cutting-edge decentralized internet platform based on a proprietary compression algorithm.
highlights: Invented the 'middle-out' compression algorithm with industry-leading Weisman Score.
Led a team of 6 to victory at TechCrunch Disrupt.
Built scalable peer-to-peer file distribution with end-to-end encryption and zero downtime.
Deployed compression engine with up to 5x efficiency over conventional methods.
Contributed to backend infrastructure for HooliSearch.
Proposed new data deduplication scheme (rejected). Later formed the basis of Pied Piper's compression layer.
Improved latency of distributed storage systems by 12%.

volunteer.summary: Taught compression fundamentals and basic Go programming to high school students.
highlights: Inspired students to build their own 'mini-Pied Piper' apps
Ran workshops on ethical computing and privacy

awards.title: Digital Compression Pioneer Award
awards.summary: Awarded for groundbreaking work in adaptive compression through 'middle-out' techniques.

awards.title: Startup of the Year
awards.summary: Pied Piper won top honors at TechCrunch Disrupt 2014.

publications.name: Middle-Out: An Evolution in Universal Compression
publications.summary: A research paper introducing a new category of adaptive compression, focused on maximizing entropy encoding efficiency.

references.name: Erlich Bachman
references.reference: Richard is a compression god. Not a literal god, but close enough. I'd invest again â€” if I had money left.

references.name: Bertram Gilfoyle
references.reference: I don't believe in leaders, but if I had to choose one to tolerate, it would be Richard.
